comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content:
Sukumar Sen was India's first election commissioner, given responsibility by Nehru for the daunting undertaking of organising India's first fully democratic elections in 1951/2.

He is pictured here in connection with his subsequent work organising free and fair elections in Sudan, which were held in November 1953, prior to the country's independence on January 1st 1956.
